meanings.definition: To preserve or cherish as sacred or precious.
meanings.sent1: Families often enshrine old photographs to keep memories alive.
meanings.sent2: Many cultures enshrine their traditional values through storytelling.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully enshrine their favorite toys in a secret box.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was enshrined in the hearts of all who knew her.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was enshrined in a glass case for all to admire.

meanings.definition: To enclose in or as if in a shrine.
meanings.sent1: The museum will enshrine the precious artifact behind protective glass.
meanings.sent2: The garden enshrines a peaceful statue at its center.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully enshrined the secret recipe in a locked box.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood are enshrined in the old family home.
meanings.sent5: The castle enshrined the royal jewels in a hidden chamber.

meanings.definition: To protect or cherish as if in a shrine.
meanings.sent1: She always enshrines her grandmother's wisdom in her heart.
meanings.sent2: The community enshrines the ancient tree as a symbol of strength.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully enshrines its favorite toy under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The love between them was enshrined in a special song.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of storytelling enshrines the history of the tribe.
